_comment: score, bonus and punishment are applied to the score, damage to the hp and thereby only indirectly to the score

_syntax:.groupPositioning: either 'solid' or 'fluid'; 'solid' takes x and y coordinates for each group from 'group_positions' and will always position the groups at these coordinates relative to the background image size; 'fluid' takes the number of groups and positions them eqally apart on an oval around the center of the game field with the player's team always on top of the screen
_syntax:.inventoryDirections: either 'up' or 'down'; only relevant if 'groupPositioning' set to 'solid'

items.name: the name displayed on the inventory list, buttons, log and error messages
items.score: points added to the score of the group for buying this item
items.plusHP: amount of HP the group recieves for buying this item. the maximum HP defined for this group will be respected.
items.plusMaxHP: adds the specified amount to the maximum HP reachable by this group. Does not add the amount to the actual HP.
items.max: Specifies the maximum number a group can possess of this item
items.requirement: The parameter has to be of the form itemn where n is a number between 1 and number_items. It specifies an other item of which the group has to possess at least one before they can buy the item.
items.deadAllowed: Set to true if the item can be bought even if the group is dead (e.g. repair kit), set to false or leave empty/out otherwise

actions.destroyItem: if the action is successfull one destroyItem (write item1 e.g.) will be substracted from the target group
actions.compareItem: the group with more compareItem is the winner
actions.score: added to the attacking group's score on success
actions.defendScore: added to the target group's score if the attack fails due to compareItem or defense
actions.scorePunishment: substracted from the target group's score if the attack succeeds
actions.uses: one of this item (e.g. item1) will be substracted from the attacking group's inventory. If none of this item is available, the attack isn't possible and an error message is returned
actions.requirement: the attacking group has to have at least one of this item. Otherwise the attack isn't possible and an error message returned
actions.multiplicator: This has to be an item (e.g. item1). score and damage will be multiplied with the amount of this item the attacking group has
actions.killBonus: will be added to the attacking group's score if they kill the target meaning it's hp is decreased to 0
actions.killPunishment: will be substracted from the target group's score if they get killed
actions.damage: will be substracted from the target group's hp if the attack is successfull
actions.defense: this is a sub group containing items (e.g. item1) as key and numbers as values. With those numbers and items the target's probability to defend itself is calculated. This probability exists even after the comparison of compareItem was successfull for the attacking group. The number specifies a percentage for the defense probability. Each number will be multiplied with the number of the corresponding item the target group has and then the sum will be calculated for the total defense probability
actions.deadAllowed: Set to true if the action can be performed even if the group is dead, set to false or leave empty/out otherwise
actions.randomOpponent: Set true to choose a random target. Otherwise the user can pick the target.

error_messages.requirement: <item> will be replaced by the item that should be bought. <requirement> will be replaced by the required item.
error_messages.max: <item> will be replaced by the item that should be bought. <max> will be replaced by the maximum number allowed.
error_messages.death: Used for items when the group cannot buy it because they are dead. <item> will be replaced by the item
error_messages.action_death: Used for actions when the group cannot perform it because they are dead. <action> will be replaced by the action
error_messages.action_requirement: Used for actions, same behavior as requirement for items
error_messages.action_uses: Used for actions. Used to inform the group that they  miss an item that will be used up for the action (e.g. cannon balls). <uses> will be replaced by the item, <action> will be replaced by the action.
error_messages.usage: It is possible to define custom messages for a certain item. This can be done creating a new sub field such as item1 containing the custom messages. If a custom message is not available the default message (which is the one written outside of the custom item blocks) will be used.

log_messages.buy: <item> will be replaced by the item bought. <group> will be replaced by the group name.
log_messages.actions: in all action related messages <group> will be replaced by the attacking group's name, <target> by the targeted group and <action> but the name of the action performed
log_messages.success: message issued if the action was successfull and no kill occured
log_messages.kill: message issued when the target group's hp has been decreased to 0, meaning it has been killed
log_messages.hitSelf: message issued when the group performing the action is the same as the target. In this case the action is never successfull
log_messages.nothingToDestroy: message issued if destroyItem is not null and the target group doesn't have any of destroyItem. This case is treated as if the action was not successfull
log_messages.failure: message issued if the action was not successfull eg. if the target could defend themselves due to comparison of compareItem or due to defense
log_messages.usage: It is possible to define custom messages for a certain item. This can be done creating a new sub field such as item1 containing the custom messages. If a custom message is not available the default message (which is the one written outside of the custom item blocks) will be used.

finalScores._comment: for the final score the hp multiplied with the given factor of each group will be added to the score. If the group is dead at the end of the game, deathPunishment will be substracted from their score. ratios: the element opening the group is required. In the required_by array any number of elements can be listed, the all present an item that requires the first item. For each requiring item the following parameters can be given: multiplicator: n of the requiring items require only 1 required item. consuming: if more than one item require the other item consuming: true means that the amount of the required item used to fulfill this requirement will not be available to fulfill other requirements any more. punishment: if 5 item1 require one item2, for each begun 5 item1, that cannot be compensated with one item2, punishment will be substracted from the score. once_punishment: if the dependency is not fulfilled, once_punishment will be substracted from the score independent on how much the dependency is not fulfilled. bonus: will be added to the score if the dependency is fulfilled
